projects.title: Electric Vehicle (EV) Confessions
projects.summary: A playful, fast-cut commercial dispelling common EV myths through exaggerated ‚Äúconfessions‚Äù‚Äîfollowed by sharp, clean visuals introducing real dealership incentives. I helped develop the storyboard and led art direction on set, guiding shot composition and visual tone. I also handled editing, color, and audio mix. The spot launched on streaming platforms, with a second life as cutdowns across social. It was part of a broader campaign integrated into the dealership‚Äôs EV incentive marketing strategy.

keypoints.title: üé• On-Set Art Direction & Storyboard Concepting
keypoints.summary: I helped shape storyboard, dialing in a tone that felt bold, lighthearted, and visually striking. While on the set, I assisted with shot composition, timing, and set direction to ensure every shot aligned with the storyboard while staying agile for real-time adjustments and creative opportunities.

keypoints.title: üñ•Ô∏è Full Post-Production Execution
keypoints.summary: I owned the edit from raw footage to final delivery‚Äîcutting for rhythm, color grading for brand tone, and mixing audio for clarity across platforms. That included custom cutdowns for social.

keypoints.title: üì≤ Social Media Integration with Dealership Marketing
keypoints.summary: I created custom edits optimized for social‚Äîshort, punchy clips designed for vertical formats and attention spans. These extended the campaign‚Äôs reach and reinforced key messages across platforms. The campaign anchored a broader EV campaign, tying into the dealership‚Äôs marketing strategy with incentive-based messaging across digital and in-store materials.

projects.title: The Risk Engineering Center
projects.summary: To spotlight Chubb‚Äôs state-of-the-art Risk Engineering Center, we created a high-impact video blending interviews, photo-driven storytelling, and sharp motion design. I worked from initial concept through final delivery‚Äîscouting locations, crafting the storyboard with my team, co-directing on set, and driving post-production with editing, graphics, and sound. The result: a bold, energetic promo that lives on Chubb‚Äôs site and across their social platforms.

keypoints.title: üìë Collaborative Concept & Storyboard Development
keypoints.summary: From the start, I worked closely with my team to shape the tone and structure of the piece. We physically arranged shot ideas on a whiteboard to fine-tune pacing and transitions‚Äîbuilding a visual rhythm that could escalate with the music. That attention to flow early on made the final product feel intentional and dynamic.

keypoints.title: üé• Hands-On Production & Camera Direction
keypoints.summary: I assisted Camera B during the shoot and handled on-the-fly setups to match the vision we‚Äôd storyboarded. I worked closely with the team to shape compositions and direct shots that would play well with layered post effects and build momentum visually as the music kicked in.

keypoints.title: üñ•Ô∏è Post-Production & Motion Design
keypoints.summary: In post, I was deeply involved in editing, adding motion graphics and layered photo treatments, and tightening sound design to give the piece its energetic finish. We balanced corporate clarity with bold visual rhythm, pushing against what you'd expect from a traditional insurance brand.

projects.title: Bahlsen Drone Drop Pop-up
projects.summary: A lighthearted, buzz-worthy activation for Bahlsen North America that dropped cookies from the sky‚Äîliterally. We created a pop-up drone event in Montclair, NJ, where Choco Leibniz packs were delivered to unsuspecting locals. I was part of this from day one: planning, directing, and helping pull the whole thing together on-site. I also edited both a full recap for YouTube and short-form versions for social and digital ads. This one was all about joy, surprise, and cookies in midair.

keypoints.title: üìç Creative & Production Planning
keypoints.summary: Day-of, I oversaw set piece placement and camera coordination, making sure we captured both the chaos and charm of drones delivering cookies. I also directed interactions with the public‚Äîguiding genuine, excited reactions that made the final video sing.

keypoints.title: üé• On-Site Art Direction & Crowd Engagement
keypoints.summary: To celebrate new packaging, Bahlsen executed an industry-first by deploying drones to distribute free samples, creating a buzzworthy experiential marketing moment that delighted consumers.

keypoints.title: üñ•Ô∏è Editing & Multi-Platform Delivery
keypoints.summary: I edited both an extended recap and a punchy, social-first cutdown, each tuned to its platform. The short version also ran as a rich media digital banner, proving a playful, experiential campaign could extend well beyond the street.
